title: Woodrose
author: Woodrose
content: Many people are always interested in Rich Quick Scheme and Farming tokens. Scammers are always happy to see how many people are investing and playing their games. Just wanna share to you guys this new farming game named LeLe Gold farm.The mechanics are not new to everyone. It is a P2E games wherein you will farm and you will be able to earn money. Well, I did not invest in this game since it is highly risk. Just like the other rich quick scheme applications.Those who are trying to enter in this game. Sorry guys, you cannot take your ROI anymore if you will play this game.Just in: SEC warns the people that LeLe gold farm is not yet regulated.Please take a look more in the website below for more information: https://www.bworldonline.com/corporate/2023/01/18/499141/sec-warns-about-unlicensed-lele-gold-farm-trading-cartel/?ampLeLe - Lesson Learned for those who are dreaming to be millionaire in one day.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: The platform is specific to one country and that is the Filipino investors I check more information about this Lele Gold because this is new to me I am led to this platform crazyfishinggames.com I delete the APK download page because the site is not working 5%-10% monthly interest is a big warning sign, Philippine-based investors are easily swayed by this kind of scheme especially those OFW because of the lack of business knowledge to grow their money, they resort to this kind of scheme its good that SEC is very fast to issue warning about this kind of scheme

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: If it's SEC that has given the advisory then people should be serious about them. Well, there's this different belief and distrust of SEC people in the crypto market. But if it's all about these scam schemes, people must take into account where they're putting their money.I've researched for some news on the web about this farm game scam and it's said that they are no longer existing. In short, this lele gold already shut down and made a complete exit.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: passwordnow on January 19, 2023, 01:19:13 AMIf it's SEC that has given the advisory then people should be serious about them. Well, there's this different belief and distrust of SEC people in the crypto market. But if it's all about these scam schemes, people must take into account where they're putting their money.I've researched for some news on the web about this farm game scam and it's said that they are no longer existing. In short, this lele gold already shut down and made a complete exit.People will ignore the warning sighns only when SEC announced that its a Ponzi scheme,whewn checking the plan and all of its feature it a Ponzi scheme, we should not wait for SEC to announce that its a Ponzi scheme because before they announce it they already scammed you, do your own research and your own judgement, don't get greedy because people are showing you their payout, these people that show you their payout are promoters or the people behind that Ponzi scheme.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on January 18, 2023, 10:37:42 PMThe platform is specific to one country and that is the Filipino investors Now I understand why I got this on their webpage:QuoteKumita ng P48 – P2880 Per Day sa pagfa-FARM sa Gold Farm (Lele Gold Coin or Crazy Fishing) Ang unang gagawin ay i-download ang app by clicking the Download. Don’t worry kung may warning like “it may harm your device” that’s normal since hindi sa Google Play nadownload. After installing and download. Join our FB Group >>> JOIN HEREI thought at first that my browser is playing a joke on me!Quote from: Woodrose on January 18, 2023, 08:12:43 AMThe mechanics are not new to everyone. It is a P2E games wherein you will farm and you will be able to earn money. Correction is a Pay to Play to Earn scheme! So more like P2P2E!  Should we throw in another P for Ponzi?As for the SEC warnings, this was pure gold:[ANN][ICO]HoweyCoins: the only BitcoinTalk-endorsed ICO - GUARANTEED PROFITI'm willing to bet that even after the warning, there will be some who will invest in this Lele scam just because they don't trust what the SEC says and they will think it's just the evil reptilians that don't want the poor people to get rich!

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: I got three invites from this scheme but since I'm not app-based guy I decline it, those promoters are good at shilling this project they promised free coins, easy to earn and you will lose miss a lot if you ignore this opportunity, its the usual Ponzi scheme strategy, FOMO or instilling fear of missing out feeling, I guess that's the end of this project, next time I got an invite I just need to show them the SEC advisory, people tend to stop inviting you from this kind of scheme if you are well informed.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on January 19, 2023, 03:48:24 PMQuote from: passwordnow on January 19, 2023, 01:19:13 AMIf it's SEC that has given the advisory then people should be serious about them. Well, there's this different belief and distrust of SEC people in the crypto market. But if it's all about these scam schemes, people must take into account where they're putting their money.I've researched for some news on the web about this farm game scam and it's said that they are no longer existing. In short, this lele gold already shut down and made a complete exit.People will ignore the warning sighns only when SEC announced that its a Ponzi scheme,whewn checking the plan and all of its feature it a Ponzi scheme, we should not wait for SEC to announce that its a Ponzi scheme because before they announce it they already scammed you, do your own research and your own judgement, don't get greedy because people are showing you their payout, these people that show you their payout are promoters or the people behind that Ponzi scheme.When it's come to these SEC warnings, many do ignore them, especially those people that have already deposited and invested their money. The reality sucks for them because they've got no longer hold their money and it's already in the Ponzi scam(o)pany. They do selective hearing and they only want to hear from the same folks that have already been a victim of that scam. It's tiring to see that many are concern and give warnings and reminders to never invest into ponzis but, the people keep coming and many new folks are getting in on it without knowing what they do.

comments.author: Woodrose
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on January 18, 2023, 10:37:42 PMThe platform is specific to one country and that is the Filipino investors I check more information about this Lele Gold because this is new to me I am led to this platform crazyfishinggames.com I delete the APK download page because the site is not working 5%-10% monthly interest is a big warning sign, Philippine-based investors are easily swayed by this kind of scheme especially those OFW because of the lack of business knowledge to grow their money, they resort to this kind of scheme its good that SEC is very fast to issue warning about this kind of scheme Sad to say but I was a victim of farming apps last year. That is why I learned a lot. I am working in other country as well and based upon your opinion. Most of the time, those Filipino workers are the victim of scam. I have been there when one of my Filipino co-worker is trying to invite OFW's without knowing that it was a scam. After that, she was sue by many OFW's because they fell in a scam and even her was a victim.

comments.author: Bttzed03
comments.body: Quote from: stompix on January 19, 2023, 04:07:42 PM~ I'm willing to bet that even after the warning, there will be some who will invest in this Lele scam just because they don't trust what the SEC says and they will think it's just the evil reptilians that don't want the poor people to get rich!Yeah, some people really think that way. Prior to Lele, there's always been a notion that our SEC is only doing this to extract money (registration fees + taxes) from these investment projects/platforms.The sad thing here is that a lot of these people already know that such schemes are not allowed by SEC but they still go for it. They will try to beat the gullible latecomers (new investors) and exit before everything crumbles.Like I said in another thread, it's a never-ending lesson learned for them.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Even after years of Pyramid and Ponzi scheme scam... People still don't understand how these schemes have been trying to evolve with new catchy words and phrases, but the mechanics and model of the scheme is always the same.I guess people have to first learn the hard way before the OP eyes1. "If you don't understand where the yield is coming from, you are the yield."2. If you don't know the source of yield, you're the yield.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on January 19, 2023, 10:37:41 PMI got three invites from this scheme but since I'm not app-based guy I decline it, those promoters are good at shilling this project they promised free coins, easy to earn and you will lose miss a lot if you ignore this opportunity, its the usual Ponzi scheme strategy, FOMO or instilling fear of missing out feeling, I guess that's the end of this project,to be honest, it's not that they are good at shilling the project, it's just that many people are stupid enough to easily believe what popular people say. Quote from: coin-investor on January 19, 2023, 10:37:41 PMnext time I got an invite I just need to show them the SEC advisory, people tend to stop inviting you from this kind of scheme if you are well informed.I did this once and not only that she stopped inviting sending me invites, she blocked me on FB(it's a win-win for me) because I found one of her posts where she is recruiting and I commented that she is a moron and she is risking people's money by encouraging people to invest on the scam she calls "investment opportunity".
